--- In gladiator@y..., dancing_corpse@h... wrote:
> i was just looking at our yahoo page (i'm infact writing this from
> the page which is y i don't have my signature) and saw all the stuff 
> dph is always talking about like # of messages pur month: only one 
out 
> of 9-10 people on this list actually talks.
> since over half the group can't get on this web site i'm making i
> site to keep all future (and already existing) downloads and poles 
(if 
> dph allows it).

I see no problems with having a backup repository of gladiator 
downloads.  Unfortunately or fortunately, Seth Mitchell is the owner 
of this list.  

The website and archives of our posted messages can be accessed by 
anybody.  The problem is you have to be registered with yahoo in order 
to post messages from the website and participate in polls and we 
would have that same basic problem anywhere: you have to be 
registered within the website to post from the website.  Remember:  
this list started off on onelist.com (before I was here) and onelist 
was bought or merged with egroups.  Egroups was bought out by yahoo.  
Being registered with egroups didn't make someone registered with 
yahoo.  That's part of the reason I want to go through the membership 
list.

4 reasons I plan on going through the membership list:
1)remove bad email addresses.
2)remove anyone from the list who does not want to be on this list
3)make sure everybody is registered with yahoo so that he/she can post 
messages from the website and participate in polls
4)do a very accurate survey of this list to find out who's interested 
in playing in a tournament.

Part of the reason I haven't started is I was looking for some topic 
that would keep this board active so I would have the time to go 
through membership list without having to keep starting new topics.

If/when we get around to working on tournament scenarios, I will 
create a separate yahoo group just to work on that short-term project. 
 Afterwards, I might leave that group around just to evaluate the 
tournament successes and failures and to make plans for another 
tournament.  I would like to have an anuual gladiator tournament.
